channel.title: 6.041 / 6.431 Probabilistic Systems Analysis and Applied Probability | Video Lectures
channel.description: This section contains lecture slides and video lectures.

item.title: Lecture 1: Probability Models and Axioms
item.description:
Description: In this lecture, the professor discussed probability as a mathematical framework, probabilistic models, axioms of probability, and gave some simple examples.

Instructor: John Tsitsiklis

Keywords: probability axioms, probability law, discrete uniform law, countable additivity axiom

Transcript: PDF (English - US)
Subtitles: SRT
Thumbnail - JPG (YouTube)
Video - download: Internet Archive (MP4)
Video - download: iTunes U (MP4)
Video - stream: YouTube

(CC BY-NC-SA)
item.dc:creator: Tsitsiklis, John
item.dc:subject: probability axioms
probability law
discrete uniform law
countable additivity axiom
item.dc:rights: Content within individual OCW courses is (c) by the individual authors unless otherwise noted. MIT OpenCourseWare materials are licensed by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology under a Creative Commons License (Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike). For further information see http://ocw.mit.edu/terms/index.htm

item.title: Lecture 2: Conditioning and Bayes' Rule
item.description:
Description: In this lecture, the professor discussed conditional probability, multiplication rule, total probability theorem, and Bayes' rule.

Instructor: John Tsitsiklis

Keywords: conditional probability, die roll, multiplication rule, total probability theorem, Bayes' rule

Transcript: PDF (English - US)
Subtitles: SRT
Thumbnail - JPG (YouTube)
Video - download: Internet Archive (MP4)
Video - download: iTunes U (MP4)
Video - stream: YouTube

(CC BY-NC-SA)

die roll
multiplication rule

item.title: Lecture 3: Independence
item.description:
Description: In this lecture, the professor discussed independence of two events, independence of a collection of events, and independence vs. pairwise independence.

Instructor: John Tsitsiklis

Keywords: conditional independence, pairwise independence

Transcript: PDF (English - US)
Subtitles: SRT
Thumbnail - JPG (YouTube)

item.title: Lecture 4: Counting
item.description:
Description: In this lecture, the professor discussed principles of counting, permutations, combinations, partitions, and binomial probabilities.

Instructor: John Tsitsiklis

Keywords: discrete uniform law, permutations, combinations, partitions, binomial probabilities

Transcript: PDF (English - US)
Subtitles: SRT

item.title: Lecture 5: Discrete Random Variables; Probability Mass Functions; Expectations
item.description:
Description: In this lecture, the professor discussed random variables, probability mass function, expectation, and variance.

Instructor: John Tsitsiklis

Keywords: random variables, probability mass function, expectation, variance

item.title: Lecture 6: Discrete Random Variable Examples; Joint PMFs
item.description:
Description: In this lecture, the professor discussed conditional PMF, geometric PMF, total expectation theorem, and joint PMF of two random variables.

Instructor: John Tsitsiklis

Keywords: conditional PMF, geometric PMF, total expectation theorem

Transcript: PDF (English - US)
Subtitles: SRT

item.title: Lecture 13: Bernoulli Process
item.description:
Description: In this lecture, the professor discussed Bernoulli process, random processes, basic properties of Bernoulli process, distribution of interarrival times, the time of the kth success, merging and splitting.

Instructor: John Tsitsiklis

Keywords: Bernoulli process, random processes, merging, splitting

item.description:

item.title: Lecture 20: Central Limit Theorem
item.description:
Description: In this lecture, the professor discussed central limit theorem, Normal approximation, 1/2 correction for binomial approximation, and De Moivre–Laplace central limit theorem.

Instructor: John Tsitsiklis

Keywords: central limit theorem, Normal approximation, binomial approximation, De Moivre–Laplace CLT
